pageTitle: PON1 Gene - GeneCards | PON1 Protein | PON1 Antibody
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {260013=The enzyme encoded by this gene is an arylesterase that mainly hydrolyzes paroxon to produce p-nitrophenol. Paroxon is an organophosphorus anticholinesterase compound that is produced in vivo by oxidation of the insecticide parathion. Polymorphisms in this gene are a risk factor in coronary artery disease. The gene is found in a cluster of three related paraoxonase genes at 7q21.3. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2008]}
textBeforeTable: Sequence variations from dbSNP and Humsavar for PON1 Gene The allelic form of the enzyme with Gln-192 (allozyme A) hydrolyzes paraoxon with a low turnover number and the one with Arg-192 (allozyme B) with a high turnover number P27169-PON1_HUMAN Polymorphic Variants from UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot for PON1 Gene Variants for PON1 Gene view
